subject: The Wolf and the Lion...
event:
... is the title of this week's episode of GAME OF THRONES on HBO.

Here's a little taste of it, an exchange between Ned Stark and Ser Barristan the Bold at the Hand's Tourney in King's Landing.


<lj-embed id="181"/>


Ser Barristan fans might be interested to know that he has a big part in A DANCE WITH DRAGONS.  In fact (drum roll, please), he becomes a viewpoint character.

props.taglist: dance with dragons, hbo, game of thrones

comments.article: Nice, I think I might like that :)
comments.subject: Really?

comments.article: Ahh, fantastic news about Ser Barristan in DANCE! I'm re-reading the series now and gaining a new appreciation for the character.
Aww... Don't post spoilers like that. Part of the fun of a new book is to see who the new PoV characters are.

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article: Apparently it's something people ask for. Everyone knew who the ACoKs povs would be ahead of time so they asked for ASoS too. I don't think it's bad, especially since we know that all POV characters promise us is that they will be there in the beginning, it says nothing about the length of time they survive ;)
Barristan is so much more attractive than I imagined.
Excellent! I can't wait to find out more about Barristan the Bold! I'm so so SO excited for this book!
YES! *Dance of Delight* I've been dying for more Ser Barristan, I can't believe we get to have his POV! When I think of all the backstory he must know... *u*
And I hope in his chapters he'll be thinking a little bit about the old times with Rhaegar, Ser Arthur Dayne,... perhaps he'll even remember Ser Duncan the Tall!!
comments.subject: Ser Barristan is cool!

comments.article: Sweet!  I always wanted to know more about him : )

comments.upictitle: twistedsheets10: jon snow kicks everyone's ass
comments.article:
OH MY GOD, a Barristan POV? I am excite! ♥♥♥♥

(I love this scene, btw (even in the books). ♥)

Yeah. The only thing I did not like about the Deanarys storyline is that it had only one POV, so that you only got one insight into the thing and all that.

Now it might just get (a lot more) interesting.

comments.upictitle: brittany ♥: thrones › badass mother of the north.
comments.article: I'm so excited to hear Barristan will be a viewpoint character in ADWD! I'm new to your work and I'm currently reading the series for the first time. I already can't wait to learn more about Barristan the Bold! :D
Barristan! Such a great character! Always in the middle of situations not of his making, somehow holding on to his honor and nobility. Now, he's finally chosen his own destiny! What awaits!?
Dare we hope that we will get some serious back-story in his chapters?
His own viewpoint?! Me rikey!
George, how could you! You just spoiled the fact that Barristan's not dead yet!
...Might want to reread some of Dany's chapters with a closer eye.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: horns
comments.article: Nice! I've always been interested in his backstory.
I want to hear stories about Ser Arthur Dayne. And Gerald Hightower. And Ser Duncan of Tarth!
Nobody takes him one on one in his prime, right?
comments.subject: Barristan

comments.article: What about the Sword of the Morning?
comments.subject: Re: Barristan

comments.article: It's a shame on the TV show people will recognize his face long before they should, depending on how things are filmed I suppose. I am thinking they will get it out of the way earlier than we'd expect.

I think, if you just dress him up differently, give him a posture that's completely different from the one at the beginning of the books, plus add a little makeup, grow his hair a bit... nobody'll recognize him :)
If you've ever seen the Monty Pythons, you know you can have an actor playing several different roles without recognizing him !
comments.subject: recognizing Barristan

comments.article: O, Lordie... I really hope this does not mean the death of Dany! She is my fave character and I hope she continues. Now I am very worried about this book!

Why would it mean the death of Dany?  We have often had multiple viewpoints on the same events, particularly in King's Landing.  With so much descending on The Mereenese Knot, I think we'll need as many PoV characters there as possible.
Oh now that is sweet. I've loved the direction you've gone with him so far. Really interested to get more in his head.

Will the name of the Chapter be: Barristan? The White Knight? Whitebeard? Arstan? The Exciled Knight?

Three cheers for an awesome PoV!
comments.subject: THe Question is...

comments.article: Isn't that a bit spoilerish???
comments.subject: Re: THe Question is...

comments.article: Barristan POV? THAT IS SO EXCITING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

What an awesome idea of making Barristan a POV character. I love his story and his back story. This allows you to reflect as him and drop the reader some knowledge of the past. And on the upcoming episode. Some of the lucky insiders who got sent the first 10 episodes a couple weeks ago (a few whos opinons I trust a lot, like Elio), claim episode 5 and 6 are the best episodes or top 3 of the whole season. Can't wait 40 hours.
comments.subject: Awesome George!!

comments.article:
Yay, Ser Barristan, I always liked him :) still hoping to make the Boston book signing.

(I am waiting to watch the TV series until my husband has read the first book, and it's painful! ;) hope to spend many happy hours with it on DVD in the future!)
I'm excited for this, but also a bit disappointed to be spoilered - I have to admit that this is the last place I'd expect to read spoilers!
Barristan POV - did that untie one of the strands in the Meereenese Knot, maybe?
